headline: Dollar Tree warns of Q2 profit hit over tariffs: Value retail stocks
summary: Discount retailer Dollar Tree (DLTR) beat earnings estimates for its first quarter, while warning investors that its profits could drop by 50% in the second quarter due to tariffs. Arun Sundaram, senior equity research analyst at CFRA Research, joins Market Domination to break down the pressure on retailer's margins and why Walmart (WMT) stands out in the industry with margin growth and new revenue streams. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

headline: Dollar Stores Dole Out Earnings Beats, Lifted Outlooks. Two Jump.
summary: Fellow discount retailer Dollar Tree topped Q1 forecasts and lifted its earnings outlook in the morning.  Ollie's Bargain Outlet topped forecasts, but the midpoint of its raised earnings guidance came in below analyst views.  Five Below reported a 43% increase in earnings to 86 cents per share adjusted.

headline: Why Dollar Tree Stock Is Sinking Today
summary: Dollar Tree published its fiscal Q1 results after the market closed yesterday and beat sales and earnings expectations.  Despite Dollar Tree topping Wall Street's sales and earnings targets for Q1, its forward guidance is disappointing investors.  Earnings will get a boost from stock buybacks, but the company's sales target for this year is prompting sell-offs for the stock.

headline: Dollar Tree Stock Falls After Retailer Warns of Tariff Pressure
summary: Dollar Tree warned that tariffs will create near-term pressure, but remains optimistic about long-term prospects.  The discount-retail chain ran up about $70 million of extra costs while the U.S. had 145% levies on Chinese goods, said Chief Financial Officer Stewart Glendinning.  Dollar Tree is partly managing rising costs by negotiating with suppliers and buying products from different countries.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree Stock Falls After Retailer Warns of Tariff Pressure

Dollar Tree is partly managing rising costs by negotiating with suppliers and buying products from different countries.

headline: Dollar Tree Warns of Tariff Hit Despite Earnings Beat. The Stock Sinks.
summary: Dollar Tree  stock fell on Wednesday after the discount retailer flagged near-term headwinds from tariffs yet reported first-quarter earnings that beat analysts’ expectations.  The stock gained Tuesday on rival  Dollar General’s   strong earnings.  Dollar Tree’s earnings for the current quarter could drop by as much as half, but the company expects to make up for loss in the second half of the year and ultimately meet its full-year guidance.

headline: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Surprises With Q1 Sales, Provides Optimistic Revenue Guidance for Next Quarter
summary: Discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales fell by 39.2% year on year to $4.64 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $7.67 billion, coming in 74.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.26 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) Surprises With Q1 Sales, Provides Optimistic Revenue Guidance for Next Quarter

The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $7.67 billion, coming in 74.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.26 per share was 4.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Dollar Tree forecasts weak second-quarter profit on tariff uncertainty
summary: The Donald Trump administration's rollercoaster tariff swings have thrown businesses into turmoil and unsettled consumers worldwide who now brace for price hikes on everything from groceries to sneakers.  While Dollar Tree is expected to benefit from resilient demand for affordable essentials in the back half of the year, it still forecast second-quarter profit from continuing operations, which exclude the Family Dollar business, could be down as much as 45% to 50% year-over-year.  Dollar Tree's shares fell about 8% in early trading as it reiterated that the sale would hurt its full-year earnings per share by 30 cents to 35 cents, mainly in the first two quarters.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree forecasts weak second-quarter profit on tariff uncertainty

Dollar Tree's shares fell about 8% in early trading as it reiterated that the sale would hurt its full-year earnings per share by 30 cents to 35 cents, mainly in the first two quarters.
